sn46.13:1.1.pli: “Sūriyassa, bhikkhave, udayato etaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ etaṃ pubbanimittaṃ, yadidaṃ—aruṇuggaṃ;
sn46.13:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the dawn is the forerunner and precursor of the sunrise.

sn46.13:1.2.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ uppādāya etaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ etaṃ pubbanimittaṃ, yadidaṃ—yonisomanasikāro.
sn46.13:1.2.eng: In the same way, for a mendicant rational application of mind is the forerunner and precursor of the arising of the seven awakening factors.

sn46.13:1.3.pli: Yonisomanasikārasampannassetaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkhaṃ—satta bojjhaṅge bhāvessati, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarissati.
sn46.13:1.3.eng: A mendicant accomplished in rational application of mind can expect to develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors.

sn46.13:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yonisomanasikārasampanno satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkaroti?
sn46.13:2.1.eng: And how does a mendicant with rational application of mind develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors?

sn46.13:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ …pe…
sn46.13:2.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,

sn46.13:2.3.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
sn46.13:2.3.eng: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

sn46.13:2.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yonisomanasikārasampanno satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarotī”ti.
sn46.13:2.4.eng: That’s how a mendicant with rational application of mind develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors.”

sn46.130:1.4.eng: Desire for rebirth in the realm of luminous form, desire for rebirth in the formless realm, conceit, restlessness, and ignorance.

sn46.130:1.5.eng: These are the five higher fetters.

sn46.130:1.6.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ uddhambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ abhiññāya pariññāya parikkhayāya pahānāya satta bojjhaṅgā bhāvetabbā.
sn46.130:1.6.eng: The seven awakening factors should be developed for the direct knowledge, complete understanding, finishing, and giving up of these five higher fetters.

sn46.130:1.8.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ …pe…
sn46.130:1.8.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,

sn46.130:1.9.eng: and equanimity, which culminate in the removal of greed, hate, and delusion. …”

sn46.130:1.10.eng: “… which have freedom from death as their objective, destination, and culmination …”

sn46.130:1.11.eng: “… which slant, slope, and incline to extinguishment …

sn46.130:1.12.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcannaṃ uddhambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ abhiññāya pariññāya parikkhayāya pahānāya ime satta bojjhaṅgā bhāvetabbā”ti.
sn46.130:1.12.eng: The seven awakening factors should be developed for the direct knowledge, complete understanding, finishing, and giving up of these five higher fetters.”

sn46.14:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
sn46.14:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

sn46.14:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākassapo pippaliguhāyaṃ viharati ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.
sn46.14:1.2.eng: Now at that time Venerable Mahākassapa was staying in the Pipphali cave, and he was sick, suffering, gravely ill.

sn46.14:1.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā mahākassapo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi. Nisajja kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ mahākassapaṃ etadavoca:
sn46.14:1.3.eng: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out of retreat, went to Venerable Mahākassapa, sat down on the seat spread out, and said to him:

sn46.14:2.1.pli: “Kacci te, kassapa, khamanīyaṃ kacci yāpanīyaṃ? Kacci dukkhā vedanā paṭikkamanti, no abhikkamanti; paṭikkamosānaṃ paññāyati, no abhikkamo”ti?
sn46.14:2.1.eng: “I hope you’re keeping well, Kassapa; I hope you’re all right. And I hope the pain is fading, not growing, that its fading is evident, not its growing.”

sn46.14:2.2.pli: “Na me, bhante, khamanīyaṃ, na yāpanīyaṃ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṃ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo”ti.
sn46.14:2.2.eng: “Sir, I’m not keeping well, I’m not getting by. The pain is terrible and growing, not fading; its growing is evident, not its fading.”

sn46.14:3.1.pli: “Sattime, kassapa, bojjhaṅgā mayā sammadakkhātā bhāvitā bahulīkatā abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattanti.
sn46.14:3.1.eng: “Kassapa, I’ve rightly explained these seven awakening factors. When developed and cultivated, they lead to direct knowledge, to awakening, and to extinguishment.

sn46.14:3.3.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgo kho, kassapa, mayā sammadakkhāto bhāvito bahulīkato abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati …pe… upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo kho, kassapa, mayā sammadakkhāto bhāvito bahulīkato abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.
sn46.14:3.3.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.14:3.4.pli: Ime kho, kassapa, satta bojjhaṅgā mayā sammadakkhātā bhāvitā bahulīkatā abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
sn46.14:3.4.eng: These are the seven awakening factors that I’ve rightly explained. When developed and cultivated, they lead to direct knowledge, to awakening, and to extinguishment.”

sn46.14:3.5.eng: “Indeed, Blessed One, these are awakening factors!

sn46.14:3.6.eng: Indeed, Holy One, these are awakening factors!”

sn46.14:4.1.eng: That is what the Buddha said.

sn46.14:4.2.pli: Attamano āyasmā mahākassapo bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandi.
sn46.14:4.2.eng: Satisfied, Venerable Mahākassapa approved what the Buddha said.

sn46.14:4.3.eng: And that’s how he recovered from that illness.

sn46.14:4.4.pli: Tathāpahīno cāyasmato mahākassapassa so ābādho ahosīti.

sn46.18:1.1.pli: “Yesaṃ kesañci, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā viraddhā, viraddho tesaṃ ariyo maggo sammā dukkhakkhayagāmī.
sn46.18:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, whoever has missed out on the seven awakening factors has missed out on the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.

sn46.18:1.2.pli: Yesaṃ kesañci, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā āraddhā, āraddho tesaṃ ariyo maggo sammā dukkhakkhayagāmī.
sn46.18:1.2.eng: Whoever has undertaken the seven awakening factors has undertaken the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.

sn46.18:1.4.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.19:1.3.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.19:1.4.eng: When these seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated they are noble and emancipating, and bring one who practices them to the complete ending of suffering.”

sn46.2:1.2.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, ayaṃ kāyo āhāraṭṭhitiko, āhāraṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhati, anāhāro no tiṭṭhati;
sn46.2:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, this body is sustained by food. It depends on food to continue, and without food it doesn’t continue.

sn46.2:1.3.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇā āhāraṭṭhitikā, āhāraṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhanti, anāhārā no tiṭṭhanti.
sn46.2:1.3.eng: In the same way, the five hindrances are sustained by fuel. They depend on fuel to continue, and without fuel they don’t continue.

sn46.2:2.1.pli: Ko ca, bhikkhave, āhāro anuppannassa vā kāmacchandassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā kāmacchandassa bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya?
sn46.2:2.1.eng: And what fuels the arising of sensual desire, or, when it has arisen, makes it increase and grow?

sn46.2:2.2.eng: There is the feature of beauty.

sn46.2:8.1.eng: This body is sustained by food. It depends on food to continue, and without food it doesn’t continue.

sn46.2:8.2.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā āhāraṭṭhitikā, āhāraṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhanti, anāhārā no tiṭṭhanti.
sn46.2:8.2.eng: In the same way, the seven awakening factors are sustained by fuel. They depend on fuel to continue, and without fuel they don’t continue.

sn46.2:9.1.pli: Ko ca, bhikkhave, āhāro anuppannassa vā satisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā satisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā?
sn46.2:9.1.eng: And what fuels the arising of the awakening factor of mindfulness, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it?

sn46.2:9.2.eng: There are things that are grounds for the awakening factor of mindfulness.

sn46.2:9.3.eng: Frequent rational application of mind to them

sn46.2:9.4.pli: ayamāhāro anuppannassa vā satisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā satisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.
sn46.2:9.4.eng: fuels the arising of the awakening factor of mindfulness, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it.

sn46.2:10.1.pli: Ko ca, bhikkhave, āhāro anuppannassa vā dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā?
sn46.2:10.1.eng: And what fuels the arising of the awakening factor of investigation of principles, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it?

sn46.2:10.2.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, kusalākusalā dhammā, sāvajjānavajjā dhammā, hīnapaṇītā dhammā, kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgā dhammā.
sn46.2:10.2.eng: There are qualities that are skillful and unskillful, blameworthy and blameless, inferior and superior, and those on the side of dark and bright.

sn46.2:10.3.eng: Frequent rational application of mind to them

sn46.2:10.4.pli: ayamāhāro anuppannassa vā dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.
sn46.2:10.4.eng: fuels the arising of the awakening factor of investigation of principles, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it.

sn46.2:11.1.pli: Ko ca, bhikkhave, āhāro anuppannassa vā vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā?
sn46.2:11.1.eng: And what fuels the arising of the awakening factor of energy, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it?

sn46.2:11.2.eng: There are the elements of initiative, persistence, and exertion.

sn46.2:11.3.eng: Frequent rational application of mind to them

sn46.2:11.4.pli: ayamāhāro anuppannassa vā vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.
sn46.2:11.4.eng: fuels the arising of the awakening factor of energy, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it.

sn46.2:12.1.pli: Ko ca, bhikkhave, āhāro anuppannassa vā pītisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā pītisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā?
sn46.2:12.1.eng: And what fuels the arising of the awakening factor of rapture, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it?

sn46.2:12.2.eng: There are things that are grounds for the awakening factor of rapture.

sn46.2:12.3.eng: Frequent rational application of mind to them

sn46.2:12.4.pli: ayamāhāro anuppannassa vā pītisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā pītisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.
sn46.2:12.4.eng: fuels the arising of the awakening factor of rapture, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it.

sn46.2:13.1.pli: Ko ca, bhikkhave, āhāro anuppannassa vā passaddhisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā passaddhisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā?
sn46.2:13.1.eng: And what fuels the arising of the awakening factor of tranquility, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it?

sn46.2:13.2.eng: There is tranquility of the body and of the mind.

sn46.2:13.3.eng: Frequent rational application of mind to that

sn46.2:13.4.pli: ayamāhāro anuppannassa vā passaddhisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā passaddhisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.
sn46.2:13.4.eng: fuels the arising of the awakening factor of tranquility, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it.

sn46.2:14.1.pli: Ko ca, bhikkhave, āhāro anuppannassa vā samādhisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā samādhisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā?
sn46.2:14.1.eng: And what fuels the arising of the awakening factor of immersion, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it?

sn46.2:14.2.eng: There are things that are the basis of serenity and freedom from distraction.

sn46.2:14.3.eng: Frequent rational application of mind to them

sn46.2:14.4.pli: ayamāhāro anuppannassa vā samādhisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā samādhisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.
sn46.2:14.4.eng: fuels the arising of the awakening factor of immersion, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it.

sn46.2:15.1.pli: Ko ca, bhikkhave, āhāro anuppannassa vā upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā?
sn46.2:15.1.eng: And what fuels the arising of the awakening factor of equanimity, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it?

sn46.2:15.2.eng: There are things that are grounds for the awakening factor of equanimity.

sn46.2:15.3.eng: Frequent rational application of mind to them

sn46.2:15.4.pli: ayamāhāro anuppannassa vā upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.
sn46.2:15.4.eng: fuels the arising of the awakening factor of equanimity, or, when it has arisen, fully develops it.

sn46.2:16.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, ayaṃ kāyo āhāraṭṭhitiko, āhāraṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhati, anāhāro no tiṭṭhati;
sn46.2:16.1.eng: This body is sustained by food. It depends on food to continue, and without food it doesn’t continue.

sn46.2:16.2.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, ime satta bojjhaṅgā āhāraṭṭhitikā, āhāraṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhanti, anāhārā no tiṭṭhantī”ti.
sn46.2:16.2.eng: In the same way, the seven awakening factors are sustained by fuel. They depend on fuel to continue, and without fuel they don’t continue.”

sn46.20:1.1.pli: “Sattime, bhikkhave, bojjhaṅgā bhāvitā bahulīkatā ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattanti.
sn46.20:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the seven awakening factors, when developed and cultivated, lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.

sn46.20:1.3.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.20:1.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā bhāvitā bahulīkatā ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
sn46.20:1.4.eng: These seven awakening factors, when developed and cultivated, lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”
